description.narrative: The private sector investment is increased in 40 disaster prone villages of Multan <(>&<)> Muzaffargarh District during. Private Sector is ready to mobilize its resources to 40 disaster prone villages of Multan <(>&<)> Muzaffargarh for fair share, working with Farmer Societies <(>&<)> Farm Service Centers. The proposed project idea came from that issues, listed and prioritized by the riverinefarming communities, farmer groups, farmer societies and Chenab Forum. Doaba Foundation had its plan to work on economic development and farmer#s empowerment of the riverine area under its #Sustainable Livelihoods# program. For this purpose, Doaba Foundation shared its ideas to its funding partners e.g. Oxfam GB, Oxfam Novib, Concern World Wide etc. Muzaffargarh is one of the most backward and poor Districts of Punjab Province, Pakistan and is prone to flood disasters and drought. Muzaffargarh District has its unique identity being encircled by two rivers. It looks like an #Island# Majority of the people are Muslim by Religion and labourers and farmers by occupation, residing in simple mud built houses in rural areas. Christian and other minorities are also living in some parts ofdistrict Muzaffargarh. District has extreme hot and cold climate throughout its area. A large area of the district consists of sanddunes and barren land. District Muzaffargarh consists of four tehsils (Muzaffargarh, Kot Adu, Jatoi and Ali Pur). Private Sector isready to mobilize its resources to 40 disaster prone villages of Multan <(>&<)> Muzaffargarh for fair share, working with Farmer Societies <(>&<)> Farm Service Centers. To promotion of farm service centers as agriculture business centers by the engagement of Private Sector for 2000 farming families and meetings with Fertilizers Companies for business dealing. Fertilizers are very important input for better agriculture farming but in Multan <(>&<)> Muzaffargarh, especially in riverine areas, good quality and at retailer price fertilizers is not available. Black marketers exploit farmers. In the proposed project, meetings with fertilizer companies will be made for business dealing. Usually, the companies e.g. Fuji Fertilizer Company (FFC), National Fertilizer Company (NFC) provides technical support to its partners <(>&<)> clients in water <(>&<)> soil testing, demo plot establishment, farmer#s education and free transportation of fertilizers to agreed places. As the output, these companies will be sensitized and promoted to set their business center/dealership to farm service centers under Farmer Associations.

participating-org.narrative:
Doaba Foundation is an operational organization that works with communities at grass root level. Doaba Foundation is working since 1997, a not-for-profit, humanitarian organization, registered as a Public Welfare Trust. A Board of Trustees, which consists of 07 members, manages Doaba Foundation. At field level a full time committed team implement projects under the facilitation of programme coordinators and executive coordinator to materialize Doaba’s goal.
Daoba vision is that Flood Disaster Prone Communities Become Self-reliant in Pursuit of their Common Interests.
And defines its mission: to improve the quality of life among rural people (particularly women and children) and, true to its name, concentrates on communities prone to flood disasters. It believes in achieving the goal through optimal utilization of available resources: physical-biological, moral and human. It seeks to build capacity of such communities incorporating even the relief activities into programmes of preparedness intervention, facilitating Emergence of self-reliant Communities.
Daoba has been a partner of Oxfam various Oxfams in Pakistan. Since 2005, Doaba and Oxfam Novib have been engaged as partners. The major thematic areas of partnership remained around building institutional capacities for emergency response. Doaba is one of the OI Consortium Members of OI Contingency Plan and has remained within OI system since 2003. Currently Doaba is managing three projects of (1) capacity building, (2) DRR work funded by Oxfam Canada through Oxfam Novib and (3) since 2009 the EC Food Facility Project - Facility for rapid response to soaring food prices in developing countries' jointly funded by EU and Oxfam Novib.
Projects in which Daoba has been/is involved: - Sustainable Livelihood, Development Interventions in Disaster Prone Area of TehsilLayyah - Community Based Disaster Risk Management in disaster prone areas of Muzaffargarh - Community Based Flood Preparedness in Southern Punjab - Gift Unwrap, with Disaster prone communities/Riverine Communities in Muzaffargarh, Jhang and Layyah Districts, Pakistan, - The WASH project, in the same area - Finally Dabo is also involved in the project "Construction of government school buildings" in Layyah.
